title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Mental Health Counselors

content.rendered:
What is a Mental Health Counselor?

Mental Health Counselors work with individuals who are dealing with mental health issues to help their well-being.

Where does a Mental Health Counselor work?

  • Mental health clinic
  • Hospitals
  • Universities and schools

How much does a Mental Health Counselor make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Mental Health Counselor is $43,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Mental Health Counselors?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Social work majors
  • Psychology majors
  • Sociology majors
Search Mental Health Counselor jobs on Handshake

Mental Health Counselor skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Mental Health Counselors succeed in their work:

  • Ability to stay calm under pressure
  • Compassion for your patients 
  • Good problem solving skills

What are some common questions about Mental Health Counselors?

Q: Are Mental Health Counselors in demand?

A: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, Mental Health Counselors are projected to grow 25% from 2019 to 2029.
